metadata.value: Although this instrument bears an inscription suggesting it was made by the Kirkman firm, and that it looks much like their usual output, an inscription under the soundboard records that it was actually made by Robert Falkener. Falkener worked for Kirkman but made at least two instruments himself which were passed off as Kirkman’s work, obviously with the intent of selling it for a higher price than his own instruments would be worth. The instrument is excellent sounding, although the machine stop mechanism works in a manner different to Kirkman’s usual operation.
metadata.label: Imprint

metadata.value: Technical description: Double-manual harpsichord. Compass 60|notes F₁,G₁ - F₆ [FF,GG - f''']. Three sets of strings, 2 × 8-ft, 1 × 4-ft. Lute (proximal 8-ft), Buff (distal 8-ft). The machine stop uses two pedals as an alternative to handstops. Rose bears the initials "IK" for Jacob Kirckman. String lengths (plucking points): F₆ 143 (63), C₆ 182 (67), F₅ 263 (77), C₅ 350 (83), F₄ 521 (96), C₄ 693 (107), F₃ 980 (125), C₃ 1184 (137), F₂ 1488 (156), C₂ 1684 (171), F₁ 1825 (189). Repair History: Machine stop added later. Restored by J.J.K.|Rhodes and W.R.|Thomas in 1953; later work by John Barnes; repair to keyboards, re-stringing and revoicing by John Raymond, 2004.
metadata.label: Description
